content:
CustomHeaderConstants CustomHeaderConstants Class

In this Article

Edit

Syntax

Declaration

public static class CustomHeaderConstants : objectPublic Module CustomHeaderConstants
    Inherits Object

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
    Object
  • CustomHeaderConstants
    CustomHeaderConstants

Fields summary

Ack
Ack

[Optional] Used to specify the feedback required for the consumption of the message by the device. Possible values: “none”: no feedback “positive”: receive a feedback message if the message was consumed “negative”: receive a feedback message if the message expired without being completed by the device “full”: both positive and negative
ActivityId
ActivityId

x-ms-activity-id The value that is used to pass activityID in REST API between services
ApiVersion
ApiVersion

api-version Specifies the version of the protocol used to make this request.
ClientAppId
ClientAppId

x-ms-client-app-id Set to the app Id of the client JWT making the request.
ClientAudience
ClientAudience

x-ms-client-audience Set to the tenant ID of the client JWT making the request.
ClientIpAddress
ClientIpAddress

x-ms-client-ip-address Set to the client IP address used in the request; this is required since the resource provider will not have access to the client IP.
ClientIssuer
ClientIssuer

x-ms-client-issuer Set to the issuer of the client JWT making the request.
ClientObjectId
ClientObjectId

x-ms-client-object-id Set to the object Id of the client JWT making the request.
ClientRequestId
ClientRequestId

x-ms-client-request-id Caller-specified request ID, in the form of a GUID with no decoration such as curly braces (e.g. client-request-id: 9C4D50EE-2D56-4CD3-8152-34347DC9F2B0). A caller-defined value that identifies the given request. If specified, this will be included in response information as a way to map the request. If the caller provides this header – the resource provider must log this with their traces to facilitate tracing a single request.
ClientTenantId
ClientTenantId

x-ms-client-tenant-id Set to the tenant ID of the client JWT making the request.
CorrelationId
CorrelationId

Used in message responses and feedback Specifies the tracing correlation Id for the request; the resource provider must log this so that end-to-end requests can be correlated across Azure.

DeliveryCount
DeliveryCount

Number of times the message has been previously delivered
EnqueuedTime
EnqueuedTime

Time when the Message was received by the server
ExpiryTime
ExpiryTime

[Optional] The time when this message is considered expired
HttpAppPropertyPrefix
HttpAppPropertyPrefix

Prefix for all Application property Http Headers
HttpDevice
HttpDevice
HttpErrorCodeName
HttpErrorCodeName
HttpIotHub
HttpIotHub
HttpIotHubName
HttpIotHubName

Internal HTTP custom headers
MessageId
MessageId

[Required for two way requests] Used to correlate two-way communication. Format: A case-sensitive string ( up to 128 char long) of ASCII 7-bit alphanumeric chars

  • {'-', ':', '/', '\', '.', '+', '%', '_', '#', '*', '?', '!', '(', ')', ',', '=', '@', ';', '$', '''}. Non-alphanumeric characters are from URN RFC.
MessageLockTimeout
MessageLockTimeout

Amount of time in seconds to lock message before abandoning the lock and allowing the message to be retrieved again
MessageLockToken
MessageLockToken

The lock token of the retrieved message

MicrosoftAsyncOperationHeaderName
MicrosoftAsyncOperationHeaderName

Azure-AsyncOperation Set to the URL where the result of the long running operation can be checked; to optionally be used in addition to the Location header.
Operation
Operation

[Optional] Used to specify the role of the message in the communication pattern. Possible values: “d2c”: telemetry message (device to cloud) “c2d”: notification “d2creq”: inquiry request “d2cres”: inquiry response “c2dreq”: command request “c2dres”: command response
PrincipalName
PrincipalName

x-ms-client-principal-name Set to the principal ID / UPN of the client JWT making the request.
RequestId
RequestId

x-ms-request-id A unique identifier for the current operation, service generated. All the resource providers must return this value in the response headers to facilitate debugging.
ReturnClientRequestId
ReturnClientRequestId

x-ms-return-client-request-id Optional True or false and indicates if a client-request-id should be provided.
SequenceNumber
SequenceNumber

iothub-sequencenumber A monotonically increasing identifier for each message
To
To

[Required] Destination of the message
UserId
UserId

[Required in feedback messages] Used to specify the origin of messages generated by IOT hub. Possible value: “{hub name}/”
